settings.label: License Key
settings.info: Put here the license key you recieved when the theme was purchased

settings.label: Product reviews by shopify
settings.info: Enables app integration. You still need to [install the app](https://apps.shopify.com/product-reviews)

settings.label: Enable checkout note in the cart widget
Enable sticky Add to cart (mobile version)
Display add to cart bar
settings.info: This bar will only appear after the scroll passes 'ADD TO CART' button

settings.label: Primary
settings.info: Used for text links and buttons

settings.label: Secondary
settings.info: Used for highlighted elements and call to action buttons

settings.label: Inversed Background
settings.info: Used for contrast sections. Tip: choose dark color if your background is light

settings.label: Inversed Text
settings.info: Used for text and buttons inside contrast sections

settings.content: To offer multiple currencies on your online store, you must first [edit your store's currency formatting](https://help.shopify.com/manual/using-themes/troubleshooting/help-script-find-money-formats).

settings.label: Enable currency conversion
settings.info: Even though prices are displayed in different currencies, orders will still be processed in your store's currency.

settings.label: Supported currencies
settings.default: INR GBP CAD USD AUD EUR JPY
settings.info: Use the country's ISO [currency code](http://www.xe.com/iso4217.php). Separate your currency codes with a space.

settings.content: To add the countdown offer to a product, just tag your product with 'countdown-{days}-{hours}-{minutes}'. Eg. countdown-0-2-30 the timer will end in 2 hours and 30 minutes. [Watch the illustration](http://g.recordit.co/5hFvZjEL0u.gif)

To display a product in the deal of the day widget, tag it with 'deal-yyyy-mm-dd'. This product will appear as the deal of the day on the date that you picked (eg. deal-2017-05-10). You can tag more products and add more than one tag to the same product. Note that if you have too much 1st level menu items, the widget might not fit in the navigation bar.

settings.label: Enable deal of the day
settings.info: If you are not using deal-yyyy-mm-dd tags in your products, you shoud disable this feature. Leaving it enabled may cause performance issues.

settings.label: Hide title and countdown
settings.info: This will save space in your navigation bar...

settings.label: Main text
settings.default: DEAL OF THE DAY ENDS IN

settings.label: Favicon
settings.info: 64x64 px .png recommended

settings.label: Fixed header
settings.info: Header stays fixed to the top of the screen, when you are scrolling

settings.content: Product card is an individual item in product lists such. Example: products on collection page, featured products, related products etc.

settings.label: Hide long product title
settings.info: Use fade out effect for text that doesn't fit so product cards have equal height

options.label: 1 row - fade out the rest of text
2 rows - truncate the rest of text

settings.label: Add margin (mobile version)
settings.info: Adds empty space between a product card and edge of the screen

settings.label: SEO title for password page
settings.info: Default is shop name

settings.label: Custom scripts
settings.info: This code included at the bottom of the page on each page load. Note: you need to wrap it with <script>your_code_here</script> tag if this is JavaScript code

settings.content: Browse any product page within the theme editor and click on the Product page section.
Scroll down to TABS and check the Use tabs box. Below, click Add content and select Tab. Add a tab title and select a blog in the dropdown.
Create a new [post](/admin/articles/new) for the content of this tab.
Make sure you select the right blog in the dropdown next to "Author". By default it's "News".
Make sure the post visibility is set to Visible, not Hidden.
Tag the blog post with the product title or product handle where you want to display this tab. You can tag more than one product.
You can also tag the collection name or collection handle and the tab will be displayed in all the product pages that are part of this collection. You can tag more than one collection.
To display the tab on all products, use the this tag: `product-all` or `collection-all`.
Repeat the steps above if you want each product (or collection) to have its own tabs, as well as its own tabs content. If any post is duplicated, only the most recent will be displayed.
If your customer is logged-in, the country in his default shipping address will be selected. If you are not sure about the  spelling to use here, refer to the first checkout page.
